txt.en: Bróin has told you how to modify the support role of your allies, by using the banner he has set up, and is waiting for you to do so.
The escape from Rushdurinul has begun -- you must defend Bróin from the attack of the Orcs!
'You cannot hold me! My servants are numberless!'
'Stop dying, you useless maggots!'
'Can none of you kill these fools?'
'Die with shame! I would kill you myself for your futility!'

'It is too soon to celebrate over-much, [placeholder], I know; but to have come even this far is something extraordinary!

'And yet, I wonder: Mazog is of great value to the forces of the Enemy. Can it be that they will consider a trade? If we were to bring Mazog before the gates of Dol Guldur, would Gorothúl accept Mazog's life in trade for that of my cousin Bori?

'I have sworn a vow that my axe shall end Mazog's life, but if greater good could be accomplished by his survival, well...it becomes a more difficult question, [placeholder]. We cannot abandon Bori now!'

'That was close, [placeholder], but we have managed to bring Mazog once more under control. I should have known he would have some fight left!\n\n'One thing is certain, friend [placeholder]: we will need to make some stronger shackles to hold our prisoner in the future!'
'Take these shackles, [placeholder], and use them to bind Mazog's wrists. They are made of iron and should be strong enough to keep him secure as we fight our way from this place.'

'Now we need to make our way from Rushdurinul, [placeholder], but I fear we have taken too long already: this place will soon be swarming with Orcs. If we hope to escape from here with our lives and that of our captive, we need someone to manage the flow of battle.\n\n'I suggest that you accept that role. You will need to tell us what our support role should be as the battle ebbs and flows. Should we focus on improving your morale, your power, the strength of your attacks, or the fortitude of your defence?'

'You think these bracelets can bind Mazog in his own domain? You are a fool if you think I cannot sunder these with even the smallest effort!\n\n'But I will wait until you are most vulnerable, [placeholder], and then you will feel my hands around your neck!'
'We must continue onward!'
'Quickly now, before more Orcs attack, let us take Mazog with us and leave this place behind!'

'Rule here? You think I want to rule here? I have no desire to rule this miserable kingdom! You have no idea what is happening, do you?

'Gorothúl's master is generous to his friends. He looks out for them. He tells them things. Mine will be the greatest of his armies!

'\qWhat reward do you desire?\q Gorothúl asked of me. \qOnly the kingdom that should be mine,\q I told him. \qThat place will not do,\q he said. \qMy master has commanded me to draw forth the great terrors of the abyss. That kingdom will never be free of them,\q he said, and only fools would disbelieve his words!'
'Thank you, [placeholder]. It pains me, truly it does, but we need Mazog.'
'How many Elves and dwarves alike will suffer if Mazog is permitted to live, I wonder?'
'Aye! Morale it is!'
'I will provide morale support!'
'I will focus on raising your morale!'
You have come to the entrance to Zurr-thurkh and should now ensure that Mazog's words are merely empty bluster before leaving.
Despite his attempt to escape, you have forced Mazog to submit. You should speak now with Bróin.
'We have made it, [placeholder]!'
'Get ready! Here they come!'
'We are out of time! Here they come!'
Talk to Bróin
Listen to the discussion of Mazog's fate
Give Bróin your opinion of his decision concerning Mazog's fate
Listen to the discussion concerning Mazog's fate
Talk to Bróin
Shackle Mazog
Talk to Bróin
Use the banner to change your allies' support role
Protect Bróin from the attacking Orcs
'If we can trade Mazog for my cousin's freedom, we must do so!'
'That is enough, Orvar!'
'Bind me at your peril, [placeholder]!'
'What do you think, [placeholder]?'
'Is that what you think?'
Bróin has been defeated
You have forced Mazog to submit
Bróin has been defeated!
'You think you have defeated them?'
'Now is our chance!'
'You sent them back to the deep shadow, but still they eye the world above.'
'They hunger to return! Gorothúl made certain they would remember the way!'
'They've somehow gotten behind us!'
'More from the rear!'
'I hope you two know what you're doing.'
'It is too late, Mazog! You will never again rule in Khazad-dûm!'
'I mean no disrespect, Bróin, but this cannot be!'
'We cannot show Mazog even the slightest mercy!'
'How many dwarves has he slain? How many of our people have died because of him?'
'I am sorry, [placeholder], but we must do this my way. I need Mazog alive.'
'He has broken free!'
'You cannot escape, Mazog!'
Instance: Escape from Rushdurinul
'Lord Mazog, I have brought one of your trolls!'
'Count on me to restore your power!'
'You want me to focus on power? Very well!'
'Power, aye!'
'We're almost there! Once we reach Zurr-thurkh we should be safe!'
'Good, [placeholder]. Come here!'
'Shout your command by this banner, and we will modify our support role. Try it now!'
'I will strengthen your defences, [placeholder]!'
'We will focus on inflicting damage!'
'Defence it is!'
'I agree! A deadly attack is best!'
'Ah ha! You cannot hope to defeat my trolls!'
'My focus is on defence!'
'Strong attacks win battles!'
'Where is my other troll? Useless maggots, you only brought one?'
'More of them, from up ahead!'
'I agree with [placeholder]. Do not make this mistake, Bróin!'
At the request of Issuriel, you relate the story of your escape from Rushdurinul with Mazog in tow.
'I don't believe this! Worthless curs!'
'Now is our chance! Let's move!'
Protect Bróin from the attacking Orcs
Talk to Mazog
'Kill them, you miserable maggots!'
Defeat Mazog and ensure that Bróin survives
'You snivelling sneaks, free me!'
Talk to Bróin
'Stop dying, you worms!'
'You'll pay for that!'
'I'll make you suffer for that, [placeholder]!'
'I've got more where that one came from!'
'It is my decision to make, and I have made it. Come here, [placeholder].'
'You call yourselves Orcs?'
'Worthless worm! Can you do nothing right?'
'Free me, you spineless curs!'
'Well? What do you have to say, [placeholder]? Do you agree with my plan? Do you think Mazog should be spared?'
Bróin is waiting to speak with you in the depths of Rushdurinul.
The Elves and dwarves are discussing the fate of Mazog.
Bróin is in the depths of Rushdurinul, waiting to hear what you have to say concerning the fate of Mazog.
The Elves and dwarves within Rushdurinul are considering the various implications of what must be done with Mazog.
Bróin is waiting to speak with you in Rushdurinul.
'We're not out of this yet!'
Mazog is in Rushdurinul. You must bind him with the shackles Bróin has given you.
Bróin is in Rushdurinul, waiting to speak with you now that Mazog is shackled.
